channel.title: Comments on: Scripting data in SQL Server 2012
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: May be it was changed in SQL Server 2008 R2 as I see the exactly same image as the second image (except for Denali as the version option)
item.content:encoded: May be it was changed in SQL Server 2008 R2 as I see the exactly same image as the second image (except for Denali as the version option)

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: May be Denis was talking about an option in SSMS (like, for example, Tools/Options) ? If so, then it should be accessed from a different way?
item.content:encoded: May be Denis was talking about an option in SSMS (like, for example, Tools/Options) ? If so, then it should be accessed from a different way?

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.content:encoded:
I just opened again my SQL Server 2008 R2. I right click on the database, select Tasks / Generate Scripts, then the Wizard comes up and it has Set Scripting Options page. On this page I go to Advanced settings and I see exactly this ‘Types of Data to Script’ where I can chose the ‘Schema and data’.

So, may be I am missing something, but it looks to me exactly the same as I have.

item.title: By: AaronBertrand
item.dc:creator: AaronBertrand
item.description: Naomi, this option is new for SSMS in SQL Server 2012. I don't think you'll see this in earlier versions unless you're talking about some add-in.
item.content:encoded: Naomi, this option is new for SSMS in SQL Server 2012. I don’t think you’ll see this in earlier versions unless you’re talking about some add-in.

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: I believe SQL Server 2008 R2 also has this option in Advanced Options
item.content:encoded: I believe SQL Server 2008 R2 also has this option in Advanced Options
